Yes, we can expect to see a significant shift towards sustainable aviation in the near future. The aviation industry has set ambitious goals to reduce its environmental impact, and sustainable aviation technologies are becoming increasingly viable and cost-effective.

For example, the International Air Transport Association (IATA) has set a goal for the aviation industry to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050, and many airlines have set their own carbon reduction targets. This has spurred investment in sustainable aviation technologies such as biofuels, electrification, and more efficient aircraft design.

In addition, governments and regulatory bodies are increasingly implementing policies and regulations that incentivize sustainable aviation. For example, the European Union's emissions trading system and carbon offset programs encourage airlines to reduce their carbon emissions, while the US Federal Aviation Administration has set noise reduction standards that are driving innovation in quieter aircraft engines.

Overall, the aviation industry is moving towards greater sustainability, and we can expect to see continued investment in sustainable aviation technologies and policies in the coming years.
